gov.epa.nrmrl.std.lca.ht.utils

Class Temporal

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.epa.nrmrl.std.lca.ht.utils.Temporal

  • public class Temporal
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is intended to contain most utilities for conversions between typed temporal objects and between such and String representations in various formats. It does not read or write from the TDB, but can perform operations on Literal objects.
    Author:
    Tom Transue

    • Field Detail

      • dateFormatter

        public static final java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateFormatter
        It appears that when retrieving a literal of type xsd:dateTime from the TDB, the Literal.getValue() method will cause an exception if the value stored does not contain fractions of a second. Interestingly the API does not appear to have problems storing such values, suggesting the question of what if any checking is done prior to typing any Literal. It would make sense for the engine to save time by assuming the user has properly typed their variable, but Jena would be better served if the getValue() function could fail more gracefully for incorrectly formatted entries. More investigation may reveal more details.
